summary: The colossal squid, found in the Southern Ocean, is the heaviest squid species, weighing up to 1,500 pounds. It has huge eyes, up to 16 inches wide, and sharp hooks on its arms and tentacles. These squids are believed to be ambush predators and a favorite food of sperm whales. Only a few specimens have been found, with the largest caught in 2007. Recently, scientists have been trying to spot and film them in their habitat to learn more.
title: Colossal squid
